list_definition.definition: a heavy fall of snow especially accompanied by a strong wind

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The mountain climbers were caught in a snowstorm.

list_ex_of_english: I do not know what he was waiting for; but he was a human snowstorm.
So we come onstage in the midst of a snowstorm.
Nothing infuriates the ordinary citizen so much as this perfect snowstorm of leaflets of every description.
Amid snowstorms, a tempestuous day, sea running high, gales blowing furiously, our battle cruiser opened fire at 18,000 yards.
Over 70,000 subscribers telephones were placed out of service by the recent snowstorm, but the position is now practically normal.
A snowstorm overtook a fourth, which was also damaged—extent unknown.
When transport breaks down through snowstorms and other things, the two services could be mutually complementary and save a great deal of trouble.
Take, for instance, the snowstorms of last year through which men had to cycle four or five miles to get to their work.
